page.title: 06OFF SHORE..ANGMERING ON SEA.
page.content: Beneath The Sea. Just off the coast of East Preston there is the wreck of a Norweigian steamship which is called the "Frode". It was built in 1917.Lloyd's War Loss book,states that the "Frode"was bound from Newhaven to Mumbles whilst ' in ballast' when she struck a mine on 11th April 1943. Closer to the shore are a group of rocks called Kingston Rocks which are uncovered at low tide.They are a good place to fish.The following fish may be caught:- Bass,bream,blond skate,cod,conger eel, silver eel,Dover & lemon sole,crabs, flatfish,lobster, mackerel,monk fish, turbot,sting ray,whiting,wrass. Shellfish found on the breakwaters and amongst the rocks include:_ Cockles,mussels, slipper limpets and barnacles.
